STATE OF MICHIGAN
DEPARTMENT OF HEALTH AND HUMAN SERVICES
GRETCHEN WHITMER
LANS ING
ELIZABETH HERTEL
GOVERNOR DIRECTOR
April 1, 2024
Jennifer Vasilovski
Family & Community Services- Livingston
3075 E. Grand River Ave.
Howell, MI, 48843-6584
Re: License #: CB470382419
Dear Ms. Vasilovski:
Attached is the Interim Inspection Report for the above referenced agency completed on
3/26/2024. Due to the violations of applicable licensing rules, a written corrective action
plan is required. The corrective action plan is due 15 days from the date of this letter and
must include the following:
• For any repeat violations, why the prior corrective action plan did not result
in compliance.
• How compliance with each citation will be achieved.
• Who is directly responsible for implementing the corrective action plan.
• Specific time frames for each citation as to when the correction will be
completed or implemented.
• How continuing compliance will be maintained once compliance is
achieved.
• The signature of the responsible party and a date.
If you fail to submit an acceptable corrective action plan, disciplinary action may result.
Please review the enclosed documentation for accuracy and contact me with any
questions. In the event that I am not available and you need to speak to someone
immediately, please contact the area manager at (517) 243-9743.
Sincerely,
Heather Reilly, Licensing Consultant
enclosure

MICHIGAN DEPARTMENT OF HEALTH AND HUMAN SERVICES
DIVISION OF CHILD WELFARE LICENSING
INTERIM INSPECTION REPORT

home, Evaluate Applicants for adoption

III. DESCRIPTION OF FINDINGS
The agency is in compliance with all applicable rules and statutes except for the following:
CPA Rule 400.12312 Foster parent training
(4) At least 1 adult member of the household must have
training in and maintain a current certification in first aid
and cardiopulmonary resuscitation from the American
Heart Association or the American Red Cross, or other
institution approved by the department.
One of six foster homes did not have current CPR/First Aid certification on file.
CPA Rule 400.12306 Application request
(3) An agency shall provide the licensee an application
for renewal of the license and document the action not
less than 60 calendar days before the expiration date of
the license. A renewal application must be provided to a
licensee, regardless of any pending recommendation for
disciplinary action of the license.
One of six licensing files did not have documentation that a renewal application was
provided to the applicant within the required timeframe.
FOM 722-06B Family Team Meeting
FTMs must occur within the required time frames as
outlined in the following tables:
2

• Permanent Ward Service Plan (PWSP) - within 30
calendar days before the case plan due date.
One of three case files did not have an FTM completed within 30 days prior to the
updated service plan.
REPEAT VIOLATION ESTABLISHED:
4/12/23 RENEWAL, CAP approved 5/1/23
5/13/22 INTERIM, CAP approved 6/15/22
FOM 722-06B Family Team Meeting
FTMs must occur within the required time frames as
outlined in the following tables:
• Within 30 calendar days after the child’s 14th
birthday and every six months thereafter.
One of three case files did not have a Semi-Annual Transition Plan completed
within 30 days of the youth turning 14.
IV. TECHNICAL ASSISTANCE
The facility was offered technical assistance in the following areas:
• Foster home renewal evaluations must be submitted no less than 15 days
before the expiration date.
• Special evaluation reports must not identify Children's Protective Services
(CPS). Children's Services or Department of Health and Human Services
(DHHS) may be used to indicate CPS involvement.
V. CONSULTATION
Consultation was not requested or provided.
VI. EVALUATION OF PERIOD UNDER REVIEW
There were no substantiated incidents of maltreatment in care during this licensing
period.
There were no incidents of substantiated corporal punishment during this licensing
period.
Corrective Action Plan Compliance
The agency has submitted one acceptable corrective action plans (CAP) during
this licensing period, and compliance with each individual CAP is as follows:
3

The CAP, approved 5/1/23, was the result of the 4/12/23 renewal evaluation. The
agency had violations regarding timely adoption evaluations, medical passports,
and family team meetings. The agency reported successfully implementing their
CAP over the past year, which led to improvement in all areas. However, there
was one repeat violation during the current review, regarding an FTM that was not
completed timely. This repeat was found in only one case. Overall, the agency has
shown compliance with their 2023 CAP.
Chief Administrator Assessment
The Chief Administrator Assessment dated 9/22/2023 was reviewed and
discussed on-site. The CA reported ongoing efforts to improve compliance,
including random file audits, the use of Infoview for tracking, and implementation
of internal tracking spreadsheets. The agency reported improvement in all Key
Performance Indicator areas. However, the CA did identify FTMs as an area
where improvement is needed.
The CA indicated there were four unplanned moves for youth during the past year.
One move was a result of a child going AWOL. Three moves were due to safety
concerns with the child’s relative caregivers.
Financial Overview
The agency's 2022 financial audit was reviewed, as the 2023 review is not yet
complete. The agency's 2023 budget was also reviewed. No financial concerns
were found.
Staff Interviews
Two staff were interviewed on-site: one supervisor and one caseworker. Both staff
reported they felt supported in their positions with the agency. Both staff stated
their supervisors and administrator are knowledgeable, helpful, and resourceful.
Staff stated they work well with co-workers and feel their efforts are valued in the
team. Staff did not have any concerns or suggestions for improvements at the
agency.
Description of Agency Walk Through
The agency continues to be located in the same office building as previous years.
There is adequate space for staff and clients to meet and hold parenting time. The
office has sufficient secure storage for confidential information.
4

VII. FIELD ANALYST FINDINGS
The DCWL Analyst identified one safety concern as follows:
Safety Alert: A licensed foster home was missing a smoke detector in the upstairs
hallway, between bedrooms.
Resolution: On 11/7/23 agency staff helped the foster parent install a new smoke
detector. Staff tested the smoke detector and insured it was working. Photos of the
installed smoke detector were provided to DCAL on 11/8/23.
VIII. RECOMMENDATION
Based on inspection findings the agency is not in compliance with all applicable
licensing statutes and rules. Upon receipt of an acceptable corrective action plan, it
is recommended that the agency continue on their regular license.
____________March 26, 2024_________________________
Heather A Reilly Date
Licensing Consultant
Approved By:
April 1, 2024
________________________________________
Samantha Way Date
Area Manager
